content: celtic cable neckwarmer gauge 4 5-5 stitches/in in stockinette finished size about 4 5 x 21 materials - 1 skein of frog tree merino worsted or about 130yds of worsted weight yarn - us #8 5mm needles - three 1 1/8 or 1 1/2 buttons - tapestry needle - matching thread optional yarn note it is important to use a yarn that you can block because the cables will cause it to curl--100% acrylic is *not* recommended pattern co 32 stitches set up row p2 k4 p4 3 times k4 p2 using the chart below knit the celtic cable pattern until you have knit at least 20 from the cast on row ending with a ws row continue in 1x1 ribbing k1 p1 across row for 4 row buttonholes row 1 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 bobble 4 k1 p1 k1 p1 bobble 4 2 times k1 p1 k1 p1 row 2 k1 p1 twice k1 co 4 p1 k1 twice p1 co 4 k1 p1 twice k1 co 4 p1 k1 twice p1 continue in ribbing for 2 row bobble all stitches in pattern weave in all ends finishing i would recommend spray blocking pin the garment to a surface such as a towel and spray it with water until it s very damp especially on the edges let it dry completely before unpinning sew on buttons using leftover yarn or matching thread pattern and charts © 2008 by lindsay henricks storm moon knits note when you read the chart read all odd row from right to left and all even row from left to right you will be slipping one stitch at the beginning of each row pattern and charts © 2008 by lindsay henricks storm moon knits
